title: D-Glucose
content: D-Glucose (C6H12O6) is a simple sugar and the most abundant monosaccharide. It is the primary source of energy for cellular metabolism. Glucose has a molecular weight of 180.16 g/mol and melting point of 146Â°C. It exists in both linear and cyclic forms, with the cyclic form being predominant in aqueous solution.

title: Acetylsalicylic Acid (Aspirin)
content: Acetylsalicylic acid, commonly known as aspirin, is a medication used to reduce pain, fever, and inflammation. Its chemical formula is C9H8O4 with a molecular weight of 180.16 g/mol. Aspirin works by inhibiting cyclooxygenase enzymes, which are involved in the synthesis of prostaglandins.

title: Caffeine
content: Caffeine (C8H10N4O2) is a central nervous system stimulant and the world's most widely consumed psychoactive drug. It is naturally found in coffee beans, tea leaves, and cacao pods. Caffeine works by blocking adenosine receptors in the brain, preventing drowsiness.

title: Ethanol (Ethyl Alcohol)
content: Ethanol (C2H6O) is a volatile, flammable, colorless liquid. It is the type of alcohol found in alcoholic beverages and is also used as a fuel and solvent. Ethanol is produced by fermentation of sugars by yeasts or through petrochemical processes.

title: Benzene
content: Benzene (C6H6) is a colorless, highly flammable liquid with a sweet odor. It is an aromatic hydrocarbon and one of the most fundamental compounds in organic chemistry. Benzene is a known carcinogen and is used as a starting material for many chemical syntheses.

title: Acetic Acid
content: Acetic acid (CH3COOH) is a colorless liquid organic compound with a characteristic pungent smell and sour taste. It is the main component of vinegar and is widely used in chemical industry for production of various acetate compounds.
